website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive flea and tick collar that comes with some nice features. However, it may not be practical for sensitive dogs or for controlling all infestations.
pros: Stands out for its bright orange color and reflective strip that can be seen from a distance
Affordable, and can be used on adult dogs and puppies over 12 weeks old
Can protect against fleas and ticks as long as seven months
cons: Inconsistent results: some users say it works, others report that it doesn't
May cause skin irritation on sensitive dogs

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work well and fits good no overpowering smell
customer_reviews.text: We are near a park with high grass wildlife and lots of fleas and ticks. We got this to supplement our dogs monthly maintenance pills for pests. It was so long it could have went around her neck twice before we trimmed it. It is comfortable on our small dog and it is reflective and bright. The slide works well to adjust it. It is almost like a second collar but you cant clip a leash to it. It has no offensive odor I can't smell it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Our neighborhood is bad for fleas... I admit that. We've fought them long and hard over the past few years. We found a good topical but use a collar in addition for extra security. We know the topical wears off faster than it should for us, but right at the end of its effectiveness, we got fleas again... the collar did nothing to ward them off.
customer_reviews.author: fraggle

customer_reviews.title: Good value, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Living out in the country one some times wishes these were made for kiddos and adults instead of having to use sprays, lotions, candles, spirals, etc. The dogs and cats are free from infestations, but they are rather small critters. Vets have informed me, flea collars don't generally work on big dogs. These last longer than most others.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGuest

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, SENT MY DOG TO THE VET IN 1 DAY
customer_reviews.text: This collar not only didn't work, but it sent my dog straight to the vet after he started coughing up mucus every 3 minutes then dehydrated him to the point of inflaming his pancreas. Now I'm sitting with a $300 vet bill thanks to a PoS $8 flea collar. Should have bought Seresto and spent the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful and monitor your dog closely when using!
customer_reviews.text: Please be careful! I purchased two of these collars for my American Bullies (male 2 years old, and female 1 year old). My older male Bully was just fine no issues with the collar, but my female received what appears to be a chemical burn from the collar! All her fur fell out under her neck area, and her skin was red! I would urge anyone purchasing to monitor their pups closely! She had the collar on for about 5 days when I finally realized it was the collar I took it off both of my dogs immediately. We now have to wait and see how her skin heals, and fur grow back! Again please just be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.text: This collar doesn't work at all. We've been trying to rid my dog of fleas ever since my brother's cat was here and brought fleas in and even after washing the dog with flea shampoo and removing all on his body by hand, he still been getting bit up and infested. This collar has not helped at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shaniel Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our pup for camping to guard against ticks and in one day she ended up with 8 ticks.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE PRODUCT!!! I am so upset my dog caught a tick while wearing, DO NOT BUY! Would give it 0 starts if I could, ONCE AGAIN DO NOT BUY!!! Go with a soresto collar.
customer_reviews.author: Ghazal Mirzaei

customer_reviews.title: OK but clasp problems
customer_reviews.text: Worked good at keeping ticks off our dog, but I hate the clasp design which is seems to be shared by most of the inexpensive collars. The clasp breaks way before the collar is ready to stop working. I got about one month on this one before I noticed my dog was chewing on his collar after the clasp broke and it fell off.
customer_reviews.author: jmkccTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The fleas are not even concerned.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure when this formula was last updated (if ever) but the fleas here in my part of Florida seem to be laughing hysterically at this flea collar. In this case it was a complete waste of money I should have just donated the money to the charity.
customer_reviews.author: BIG BRYAN'S BIG ADVENTURE

customer_reviews.title: Not the same color !
customer_reviews.text: In the box the collar looks red , that’s why I bought it. But in real life is orange pink. I hate it Will never 👎🏻 buy anything from your company again. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Rios

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work I was told on time ago that flea collars didn't work but I bought them anyway because I figured why do they sell them if they don't work

customer_reviews.title: SEVERE ALLERGIC REACTION!!!
customer_reviews.text: Put the collars on each of my three dogs, by the second day, woke up to one dog (25 lbs) vomiting profusely and the other had bloody sores on her neck where the collar was, and also had a swollen eyelid. Made all three dogs VERY itchy! Returning for full refund. Thank god I took the collars off in time...that would have been an expensive trip to the vet! Had to dose my one dog (60 lbs golden) with benadryl and antihistamine eye drops....NOT OK for any size dog!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 dogs and they all have the collars ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs and they all have the collars on them. The dogs spend most of the day outside and in the 2 weeks I've had the collars on them I've only found 1 tick on just one of the dogs. So for half the cost of the more expensive name brand ones I believe these will do the job just as well.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy Olson

customer_reviews.title: They need to put a bittering agent on these
customer_reviews.text: My dogs tend to get ahold of the collars and chew them off into small orange specs all over the house if they get too loose.. consider adding a chew deterrent bad taste to the collars. But that would mean less sales due to not having to rebuy when chewed up.. amirite?

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, had to have vet visit
customer_reviews.text: 2 weeks after putting it on, my dog was covered in fleas. Just cost us $88 to have vet give her a flea shot. Would rate a zero if I could.

customer_reviews.text: My dog had a skin reaction to this product. She developed sores around the collar and scratched incessantly. When I changed brands it stopped. I cannot recommend this product.

customer_reviews.text: My pup came down with fleas, ordered this and within a few days he was no longer itching. I combed him over, and can't find a single flea! Definitely worth it for me.

customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what I expected, but I didn’t think I’d be getting something as weak as a utility belt on an action figure. My dog doesn’t even have Kung fu grip or cool karate chop action, but she broke the buckle on this in a day.

product_meta.title: Hartz UltraGuard Plus Reflective Orange Flea & Tick Collar for Dogs and Puppies
product_meta.description: Tell pesky parasites to ‘bug off’ with the Hartz UltraGuard Plus Orange Reflective Flea & Tick Collar for Dogs & Puppies. This bright orange collar kills and repels both fleas and ticks on pups with necks up to 22 inches for 7 months, and also prevents flea eggs from hatching for over half the year - stopping the flea life cycle and inhibiting reinfestation. The water resistant design remains effective even after getting caught in the rain. Additionally, the Reflect-X Shield reflects direct light for up to 300 feet for an added dimension of nighttime safety. For continuous flea and tick protection from head to tail, replace the collar every 7 months. For use on puppies 12 weeks of age and older. Directions: Remove collar from package, unroll and stretch to activate insecticide generator. Do not use on puppies under 12 weeks of age. Do not unroll collar until ready to use. Place the collar around the dog’s neck, adjust for proper fit and buckle in place. The collar must be worn loosely to allow for growth of the dog and to permit the collar to move about the neck. Generally, a properly fitted collar is one that, when fastened, will snugly slide over the dog’s head. Leave 2 or 3 inches on the collar for extra adjustment and cut off and dispose of the extra length. Consult a veterinarian before using this product on debilitated, aged or medicated pets. Sensitivity may occur after using any pesticide product for pets. Some animals may become irritated by the collar if it is applied too tightly. If this occurs, loosen the collar. If irritation continues, remove the collar and bathe your dog with mild soap and rinse with large amount of water. If signs continue, consult a veterinarian immediately. Do not use this product on dogs simultaneously or within 30 days before or after treatment of other flea and tick products. However, flea and tick collars may be replaced immediately.
feature_bullets: Kills and repels fleas and ticks, plus prevents flea eggs from hatching for 7 months. Can be worn simultaneously with your dog's regular collar
Orange collar with reflective strip reflects direct light from up to 300 feet away for an added dimension of night time safety
Water-resistant design won't cause loss of effectiveness if your playful pup takes a stroll in the rain
Fits dogs with necks that measure up to 22 inches
For use on adult dogs and puppies 12 weeks of age and older
